articles.headline: A Study That Set the Tone for Austerity Is Challenged
articles.snippet: A 2010 paper argued that countries with heavy debt loads tended to experience slower rates of growth. A new study argues that the paper was flawed, in part because of calculation errors.
articles.abstract: A 2010 paper argued that countries with heavy debt loads tended to experience slower rates of growth. A new study argues that the paper was flawed, in part because of calculation errors.
articles.lead_paragraph: 8:10 p.m. | Updated WASHINGTON — In recent years, policy makers in Europe and the United States have fastened on the notion that reaching a certain heavy burden of debt would threaten future economic health — often to justify austerity budgets that increased unemployment and sapped economic strength in the here and now.

articles.headline: Putin Nemesis Stays Defiant Ahead of Trial
articles.snippet: The anticorruption blogger Aleksei A. Navalny is trying to etch a lasting image in the public imagination before his trial on embezzlement charges begins Wednesday.
articles.abstract: The anticorruption blogger Aleksei A. Navalny is trying to etch a lasting image in the public imagination before his trial on embezzlement charges begins Wednesday.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — When middle-class Muscovites massed for the first time on Dec. 5, 2011, chanting “Putin is a thief,” many were there because of the anticorruption blogger Aleksei A. Navalny.

articles.headline: Google Emulates Apple in Restricting Apps for Glass
articles.snippet: In a departure from previous products like Android, Google has set extensive limits on the apps developed for its Internet-connected glasses.
articles.abstract: In a departure from previous products like Android, Google has set extensive limits on the apps developed for its Internet-connected glasses.

articles.headline: F.D.A. Bars Generic OxyContin
articles.snippet: The move by the Food and Drug Administration represents a victory for the manufacturer and others who feared feeding street demand for the powerful painkiller.
articles.abstract: The move by the Food and Drug Administration represents a victory for the manufacturer and others who feared feeding street demand for the powerful painkiller.
articles.lead_paragraph: In a major policy move, the Food and Drug Administration said Tuesday that it would not approve generic versions of the powerful narcotic OxyContin, the painkiller that symbolized a decade-long epidemic of prescription drug abuse.

articles.headline: Perfection Is the Enemy of Reform
articles.snippet: An advocate of the rights of immigrant farm workers says they are more concerned with achieving any reform to immigration policy than in seeing an ideal package.
articles.abstract: An advocate of the rights of immigrant farm workers says they are more concerned with achieving any reform to immigration policy than in seeing an ideal package.
articles.lead_paragraph: Luis Magaña has been an advocate of the rights of immigrant farm workers for his entire adult life.

articles.headline: New Publisher Authors Trust: Themselves
articles.snippet: Self-publishing is expanding beyond first-time writers who can’t get deals, as big names like the playwright and author David Mamet are choosing this route, another sign that digital disruption is reshaping the publishing market.
articles.abstract: Self-publishing is expanding beyond first-time writers who can’t get deals, as big names like the playwright and author David Mamet are choosing this route, another sign that digital disruption is reshaping the publishing market.
articles.lead_paragraph: When the Pulitzer Prize-winning playwright and author David Mamet released his last book, “The Secret Knowledge: On the Dismantling of American Culture,” with the Sentinel publishing house in 2011, it sold well enough to make the New York Times best-seller list.

articles.headline: Doctors Saved Lives, if Not Legs, in Boston
articles.snippet: Surgeons faced life-changing decisions as patients arrived with gruesome leg trauma.
articles.abstract: Surgeons faced life-changing decisions as patients arrived with gruesome leg trauma.
articles.lead_paragraph: BOSTON — So many patients arrived at once, with variations of the same gruesome leg injuries. Shattered bones, shredded tissue, nails burrowed deep beneath the flesh. The decision had to be made, over and over, with little time to deliberate. Should this leg be amputated? What about this one?
articles.byline: By Gina Kolata, Jeré Longman and Mary Pilon

articles.headline: Seeking Gun or Selling One, Web Is a Land of Few Rules
articles.snippet: A Times examination found that unlicensed sellers advertise scores of weapons on free classified ads Web sites where people legally barred from gun ownership can buy them.
articles.abstract: A Times examination found that unlicensed sellers advertise scores of weapons on free classified ads Web sites where people legally barred from gun ownership can buy them.
articles.lead_paragraph: The want ads posted by the anonymous buyer on Armslist.com, a sprawling free classified ads Web site for guns, telegraphed urgency.
articles.byline: By Michael Luo, Mike McIntire and Griff Palmer

articles.headline: Suspicions in Boston Attack Turn to Man Seen in Videos
articles.snippet: In the first major break in the hunt for the Boston Marathon bomber, F.B.I. personnel found security video showing a man they believe may have played a role in planting explosives.
articles.abstract: In the first major break in the hunt for the Boston Marathon bomber, F.B.I. personnel found security video showing a man they believe may have played a role in planting explosives.
articles.lead_paragraph: BOSTON — In the first major break in the hunt for the Boston Marathon bomber, F.B.I. personnel on Wednesday found security video clips that showed a man they believe may have played a role in planting the explosives that killed three people and injured more than 170 on Monday.
articles.byline: By Katharine Q. Seelye, Scott Shane and Michael S. Schmidt

articles.headline: Mortgage Relief Checks Go Out, Only to Bounce
articles.snippet: Some checks to troubled homeowners bounced after they were issued by the consulting company hired to distribute settlement payments.
articles.abstract: Some checks to troubled homeowners bounced after they were issued by the consulting company hired to distribute settlement payments.
articles.lead_paragraph: 11:25 p.m. | Updated When the bank account is running dry and the mortgage payment is coming due, the phrase “insufficient funds” is the last thing you want to hear.
articles.byline: By Jessica Silver-Greenberg and Ben Protess

articles.headline: Senate Blocks Drive for Gun Control
articles.snippet: A wrenching national search for solutions to the violence that left 20 children dead in Newtown, Conn., all but ended after the Senate defeated several gun-related measures.
articles.abstract: A wrenching national search for solutions to the violence that left 20 children dead in Newtown, Conn., all but ended after the Senate defeated several gun-related measures.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A wrenching national search for solutions to the violence that left 20 children dead in Newtown, Conn., all but ended Wednesday after the Senate defeated several measures to expand gun control.
